#16991 adds ≃ₜ* and ≃ₜ+, continuous isomorphisms of multiplictive and additive topological objects (for example topological groups). It was created in September and looks ready to me. There's an open question by Yael for @Anne Baanen (or anyone else who understands EquivLike properly) about whether we want

instance : CoeFun (M ≃ₜ* N) fun _ ↦ M → N where

given that the PR also adds

instance : EquivLike (M ≃ₜ* N) M N where

and there's an unresolved conversation which is resolved by #19193 (which is not merged but also not a prerequisite for this PR). I've been looking forward to this PR for months. Is it ready yet?
I'm fairly certain we don't want/need the CoeFun instance. We sometimes needed these in Lean 3 when Lean would get stuck in metavariable hell, but I think they're no longer necessary.
The second PR you mentioned is delegated.
@Jireh Loreaux it's delegated but it really should use a review. Johan delegated it before it passed CI, and I have to do an entirely new refactor to get it to pass CI
I will make the entirely refactor a separate PR
Okay, in that case please take the label off.

Jireh Loreaux said:

I'm fairly certain we don't want/need the CoeFun instance. We sometimes needed these in Lean 3 when Lean would get stuck in metavariable hell, but I think they're no longer necessary.

One other advantage of defining a custom CoeFun/FunLike instance is that it can short-circuit the search since it would not need to traverse the CoeFun -> FunLike -> EquivLike inheritance hierarchy. On the other hand, I would expect that only brings a very local advantage (on the gripping hand, no performance disadvantage elsewhere either, due to discrimination trees.)
@Yury G. Kudryashov are you happy with this PR now?
Unless I raise some objections in the next 12h, please assume that I'm happy with this PR.
UPD: I see that it's already merged. Sorry, I wasn't reading my messages around New Year.
For whoever is reading, I have split the part of #19193 relevant to this topic to #21031
